page.title: 10 The Bevois Valley Area
page.content: The children at Bevois Town School have parents who come from Jamaica, India, Pakistan and England. Many of the children go to the temple every Sunday. The girls like to dress up in suits. When they are older they will wear saris. The boys wear ordinary clothes. The temple is in Peterborough Road. Before we enter the temple we have to cover our heads with scarves called chunia. The boys have hankerchiefs which they can take off when they go downstairs. The children like the temple. After we take our shoes off we go upstairs to pray and sing. Afterwards we have apples and oranges and sweets. We like to eat and play best.
